From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin inhālāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [i.nəˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [i.naˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

inhalar (first-person singular present inhalo, first-person singular preterite inhalí, past participle inhalat)

  1. to inhale

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of inhalar (first conjugation)
infinitive inhalar
gerund inhalant
past participle masculine feminine
singular inhalat inhalada
plural inhalats inhalades
person singular plural
first second third first second third

imperfect inhalava inhalaves inhalava inhalàvem inhalàveu inhalaven
future inhalaré inhalaràs inhalarà inhalarem inhalareu inhalaran
preterite inhalí inhalares inhalà inhalàrem inhalàreu inhalaren
conditional inhalaria inhalaries inhalaria inhalaríem inhalaríeu inhalarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present inhali inhalis inhali inhalem inhaleu inhalin
imperfect inhalés inhalessis inhalés inhaléssim inhaléssiu inhalessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — inhala inhali inhalem inhaleu inhalin
negative (no) — no inhalis no inhali no inhalem no inhaleu no inhalin

Related terms

[edit]
  • inhalació
  • inhalador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “inhalar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “inhalar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “inhalar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “inhalar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • inalar (reintegrationist)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin inhālō.

Verb

[edit]

inhalar (first-person singular present inhalo, first-person singular preterite inhalei, past participle inhalado)

  1. (transitive) to inhale
    Synonyms: inspirar, aspirar
    Antonym: expirar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of inhalar
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person

Related terms

[edit]
  • inhalación
  • inhalador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “inhalar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Ido

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

inhalar (present tense inhalas, past tense inhalis, future tense inhalos, imperative inhalez, conditional inhalus)

  1. to inhale

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of inhalar

infinitive inhalar inhalir inhalor
tense inhalas inhalis inhalos

passive participle 		singular inhalato inhalito inhaloto
plural inhalati inhaliti inhaloti

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin inhālāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /inaˈlaɾ/ [i.naˈlaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: in‧ha‧lar

Verb

[edit]

inhalar (first-person singular present inhalo, first-person singular preterite inhalé, past participle inhalado)

  1. to inhale
    Synonym: inspirar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of inhalar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive inhalar
gerund inhalando
past participle masculine feminine
singular inhalado inhalada
plural inhalados inhaladas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person

vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros

vosotras 		ellos/ellas

1Rare; now chiefly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tuteo-form for the present subjunctive.
